abstract: Ben Ratliff notes that New York Public Library for the Performing Arts has acquired archives from estate of musician, singer and composer Arthur Russell and is preparing to make recorded materials available for online streaming.

headline.print_headline: Inside the Trove of a Genre-Buster
headline.main: Inside the Trove of the Genre-Buster Arthur Russell

keywords.value: New York Public Library for the Performing Arts
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: The composer’s archives, to be donated to the New York Public Library for the performing Arts, give a sense of the many music scenes he influenced.
lead_paragraph: The composer’s archives, to be donated to the New York Public Library for the performing Arts, give a sense of the many music scenes he influenced.
